overview.intro: During decomposition, gases and fluids accumulate inside the corpse, causing the body to swell and produce foul odors. This unstable state makes the creature dangerously volatile, ready to explode with any strong impact.
features: Necromantic Reanimation — A Bloated is created through necromancy or wild magic surges.
Mindless — Moves directly toward foes, ignoring obstacles and danger. Without orders, it attacks any living being or stands idle.
Rotting Appearance — Its body reflects its original cause of death (sun-scorched, maggot-ridden, waterlogged, etc.).
Undead Nature — Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.

weakSpots: Head (CA +5). On a hit, the attack becomes a critical hit.
Mechanical Stress. When the Bloated suffers more than half of its maximum Hit Points in one hit, its body ruptures without exploding. Choose one effect:
Head — The head pops off, venting gases violently but without triggering the explosion. The creature loses all senses but keeps attacking blindly, dying in 2 turns without activating Unstable.
Arms — The arms are torn off, spilling fluids. The creature has disadvantage on attacks and cannot perform actions requiring arms.
Leg — One leg is torn off, making the creature fall prone. Its speed becomes 5 ft. and it cannot stand up.
affixes: Élite — +5×PB bonus to HP, +2×PB to AC, +1×PB to attack rolls.
Sturdy Head — Attacks targeting the Head weak spot suffer −10 penalty. If the attack misses, the Bloated can make an opportunity attack as a reaction.
Frenzy — Gains Multiattack (two Slam attacks). If it already has Multiattack, it makes three Slam attacks instead.
Highly Unstable — The Unstable saving throw DC increases by 6.
